There is also a reasonably strong correlation between thepercentage change in spending and interest rates lagged one year.This same relationship also holds with the available quarterly series onconstruction contracts. These data show the floor space of new buildings forwhich construction contracts have been drawn up during the quarter.24 This isa series that one might, reasonably expect to respond quickly to movements ininterest rates because it refers to planned rather than actual expenditures.And indeed, over the period 1933—1942, the contemporaneous correlation betweenthe percentage change in construction contracts and the ex ante real rate is—O.4.
